etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "tree") + phonetic: 可(可) (kě, "can") = tree-related object -> branch; axe handle
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 木(木) (mù, "tree"), signifying a wooden object, with 可(可) (kě, "can"), which provides the pronunciation. This reflects its meaning related to parts of a tree, such as branches or axe handles.

examples.chinese: 古斧的柯(古斧的柯)经过匠人的精心打磨(經過匠人的精心打磨)，仍然结实(仍然結實)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ fǔ de kē jīngguò jiàngrén de jīngxīn dǎmó, réngrán jiéshí.
examples.english: The axe handle of the ancient axe remains sturdy after the craftsman's meticulous polishing.

examples.chinese: 老树的柯(老樹的柯)，承载着岁月的痕迹(承載著歲月的痕跡)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo shù de kē, chéngzài zhe suìyuè de hénjì.
examples.english: The branch of the old tree bears the marks of time.

examples.chinese: 他拿起斧头(他拿起斧頭)，细看那光滑的柯(細看那光滑的柯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná qǐ fǔtóu, xìkàn nà guānghuá de kē.
examples.english: He picked up the axe and closely examined its smooth handle.
